text: Hazy with a good bit of lacing. Honeydew melon big alcohol hit in the finish. Bottle at home.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Dark gold, a bit hazy. No head but theres some visible carbonation. Light aroma of papaya, apricot, some doughy yeast. It smell so like its going to be quite sweet, and it is. Sweet with alcohol not hidden at all. Some tropical fruit hop bitterness gives some balance but it remains big, boozy and brash. The unwieldy booze burns a bit on the way down. Strong lagers are a hard style to carry off for me, and this is far better than most, but its a trifle messy.
From a 350mL bottle. A little unrefined - a wash of sweetness with strong ale characters.

Appearance: Orange golden, hazy. Slight off-white head.
Aroma: Light malt, light fruits.
Taste: Malt, sweet, fruits, syrup. Light bitterness afterwards.
Bought: Beers of Europe, 350 ml, £3.89
Info: 25/3-2017, BB: 7/8-2017
350ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours hazy gold with a medium-sized yellowy head. Aroma is hops, pineapple and malt. Taste is fruity, strong bitterness, malt.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Hazy gold body, with slighthead. Nose is hoppy, not much. Taste malts, but very slight again. Some citrus and hops. Dry in the finish.

Bottle. Cloudy golden beer with a good strong white head. The aroma is well hopped, and the flavour is very dry and strongly florally hopped. Overall a nice strong IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

350ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Hazy golden orange colour with a thick two-finger white head which was long-lasting. Aroma is hoppy with some sweet malt and fruit, pine, alcohol. Taste is mostly the same with a strong hop presence, sweet malt, pine, bitter finish with alcohol and some strange floral flavours. Nice beer though.

18th April 2016Hazy gold beer, tidy white head. Palate is light, semi dry and has decent fine carbonation. Smooth malt base, but there is a grainy alcohol here to, almost vodka like. Mild floral spice. Whisper of citrus peel. Smooth semi dry finish. A little odd but not unpleasant.

Bottle at Pibar, LausanneHazy golden color with small creamy head. Nice aroma, some sweaty hop. Smooth mouthfeel; good malt flavor with hay and cereal character; mild resins, strong bitterness, providing also some hop quality.Good.
no por nada la Double Imperial Pilsen de Rothhammer ha sido reconocida por segundo año consecutivo como la mejor rubia de Chile, excelente aroma y gran sabor ahumado en boca.
On tap at Cerveceria Imperio, Santiago. Deep golden, stable head. Piney hop nose followed by complex hop bitterness hinting of pine, perfume and spices. Nice.

Great beer. Poured a golden amber. Hopppy spruce, slightly bitter aroma. A very complex flavor with strong hop influence. If you dont like hops you wont like this beer. The flavor really stays in the mouth long after a taste.Smooth finish with very little alcohol flavor, at 9 degrees very well done!

On bottle from Bierfest Santiago.
Golden color, good foam.
Intense hoppy aromas (pine), caramel, toffee- some fruitiness.
Full body & high complexity.
Solid bitterness- ibus ( 30) making an effect.
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
